result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas Scott Kohl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Injury by Use/Vehicle-Control. Substance, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(am).
  • Injury by Use/Vehicle-Control. Substance, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(am).
  • Cause Injury/Operate-Control. Substance (1st) (PAC<0.15), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol.  
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.  
Not to possess or consume any controlled substance not prescribed by authorized medical personnel.  
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  
Not to drive with any mind-altering substance in system.
Court orders defendant is not eligible for Electronic Monitoring.

Pay resitution per previous court order.

Pursuant to Order - Amendment to Judgment of Conviction dated 02/07/2018, balance of restitution owed is $11,568.32.
Civil judgment for $6,000 on 08/09/2017 per 2nd Amended Restitution Order (DOc-31) dated 07/08/2016.  
The balance of $5,568.32 is to be assessed and collected by DOC thru Counts 3 and 4.

timeConds.notes:
re: Ct. 4
Jail to tally up good time coming as to what defendant has served so far. 
May serve time in any county jail if no cost to Chippewa County.
Court orders defendant NOT eligible for Electronic Monitoring.

Pursuant to Court on 10/18/2017, Jail is to tally up - any credit if revoked.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock Device shall be installed prior to operating a motor vehicle.  The length of Ignition Interlock Device will begin when a valid driver's license or occupational license has been issued.  (Call Dept of Motor Vehicles with questions).  Court finds defendant eligible for reduced cost on Ignition Interlock Device due to hardship.
Deferred agreement in effect in Counts 3 & 4 of the information for the duration of probation.

miscConds.notes:
$80,140.04 represents restitution plus $8,014.00 restitution surcharge. Restitution hearing to be scheduled.

Pursuant to Restitution Hearing on 6/1/2016; Restitution in the amount of $12,000 to be paid by income assignment at a rate of $250 per month. Ordered to pay $6,000 in restitution as a condition of the 2 year DAGP entered into on 4/6/16.

Pursuant to Amended Restitution Order (DOC-31) dated 06/30/2016, $12,000 represents restitution plus $1,200 restitution surcharge.  Restitution hearing was held on 06/01/2016.  Court ordered monthly payment of $250 to be paid during the length of Probation.  $6,000 to be paid during the length of the DAGP and the remaining $6,000 to be converted to a civil judgment.

Pursuant to 2nd Amended Restitution Order (DOC-31) dated 07/08/2016, $11,750 represents restitution plus $1,200 restitution surcharge.  Defendant sent restitution payment to Victim Services.  Payment was applied to restitution.

Pursuant to Order - Amendment to Judgment of Conviction dated 02/07/2018, balance of restitution owing, $11,568.32, is now assessed in Counts 3 and 4 of 15CF52.

Plus supervision fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. $200 represents DNA surcharge.  $35.00 represents Blood Draw Test fee.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol.  
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.  
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, unless approved by agent.   
Not to drive w/o a valid driver's license.   
Not to drive with any alcohol/illegal drugs in system.

timeConds.notes: To be completed within first 6 months of probation. May serve in Rusk Co. if at no cost to Chippewa Co.
